poem:
**Autumn at The General Tarleton**

In this Yorkshire pub,  
where the ale listens patiently  
to tales unraveling at the bar,  
Tommy Banks crafts autumn  
like an artist with warm hands.  
The leaves drop their amber,  
while inside, plates gather whispers,  
and each sip of cider  
echoes with the laughter  
of those who came to escape.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "30 of the best UK pubs for an autumn escape with great food ENGLAND The General Tarleton, North Yorkshire Tommy Banks, one of Yorkshire’s favourite foodie sons, is best known as the chef behind Michelin-starred restaurant the Black Swan at Oldstead, but he’s no stranger to pubs. In fact, the Black Swan started out as one, with Banks working behind the bar of his family’s pub before graduating to the kitchen. In 2023, he opened the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
